resources.string: Please log in to use this feature!

WISDOM stands for Williamsville Information System Displayed On Mobile. With the intent of providing an mobile experience which is on par to the service which the Williamsville District provides, and to create an educational experience for the developers, we have decided to create an app which satisfies all needs of the student population, while at the same time, provide an extended information system based off user input.

When you enter your credentials, it first sends your username and password to a secure server, which is hosted by Ex Nihilo, and programmed by the same programmers who programmed WISDOM. Then, the server sends data to WITS, in which it then takes the data received from WITS. The data is interpreted and sent back to WISDOM, to be shown to you, the user.
What information is saved on the server?
Nothing. That\'s right. Nothing. The server acts as a data interpretation service. It only relieves, reformat, and sends the data to its requested location.
What about information saved on my device?

Unless you specifically check the remember me button, no personal user data is saved. Only information not personal, such as East Side News, are cached on your phone, in case of an internet shortage, as well as the last username entered on the login page. If you do choose to save personal data, your data is encrypted, and is cached only on your device. On logout or reboot, if you choose to not save data, all cached personal data is wiped.
Were you asked to program this?

No. The Williamsville District has no intention of creating a mobile platform, a student at one of the schools has taken the project up themselves to create one. The process above, is, unfortunately necessary, as the district has no intention of creating an interface for applications such as WISDOM to use. This is why, as a result, the programmers must use such a roundabout method.
Who are you? Can I contact you?

\"Ex Nihilo\" is a phrase meaning \"from nothing\". Although used heavily in religious contexts, it resonates with our origins. Although we are simply ordinary students at Williamsville East High School, we are as excellent as those with a decorated history. We have the drive and passion to innovate, design, and create at
any stage in our life. We want to show that things can come ex nihilo.
If you have any business inquiries, please contact us at ExNihiloDev@gmail.com. Please insert the tag "[WISDOM Business]" or your email may be caught by the spam filter.
